oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Cabinet card of Union soldiers at Lookout Mountain
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Image of a group of Union soldiers ascending a laddered trail up Roper's Rock on Lookout Mountain to have their photograph taken. The ladders were antebellum, part of a tourist trail up the mountain, and these soldiers probably are re-enacting,; for the benefit of the photographer, the Union charge on Nov. 25, 1863 up Lookout Mountain in "The Battle Above the Clouds."
